nodes.name: Ship
nodes.devNote: FIXME If there's a proper memory address to the ship/elevator it was in hiding

nodes.name: Escape Zebes
nodes.devNote: Not a normal elevator so no nodeaddresses to or from here

nodes.name: Junction (Left Ledge Below Bomb Blocks)
nodes.note: Represents the ledge on the way to gauntlet, but on the right side of the bomb blocks.

nodes.name: G-Mode Morph Junction (Ship)
nodes.note: Represents being at the Ship with G-Mode Morph (artificial morph)

to.devNote: This link is only for sparking and G-mode. All other strats should go 1 -> 7 -> 5 -> 4.
This link is only for sparking, blue space jump, and G-mode. All other strats should go 4 -> 5 -> 7 -> 1.
This link is only for sparking and G-Mode. All other strats should go 5 -> 4 -> 3.

strats.name: Leave With Spring Ball Bounce (Short Runway)
Leave Spinning (Long Runway)
strats.note: Gain speed using the long runway at the top-right of room, and use Space Jump to carry it into the next room.

strats.name: Leave With Mockball (Long Runway)
strats.note: Gain speed using the long runway at the top-right of room, and use Space Jump to carry it across the room into a mockball (or speedball) at the doorway.

strats.name: Leave With Spring Ball Bounce (Long Runway)
strats.note: Gain speed using the long runway at the top-right of room, and use Space Jump to carry it across the room into a spring ball bounce into the other room.

strats.name: Leave Space Jumping (Long Runway)
strats.note: Gain speed using the long runway at the top-right of room, and use Space Jump to carry into the other room.
strats.devNote: This runway has some unusable tiles because the Space Jump descent will not work with too high speed.

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.note: Shinespark through the top of the door to reach the breakable blocks.
strats.devNote: The shinespark may end early dropping Samus into 7, or 5. But speed alone is enough to reach any of 4, 5, and 7.

strats.name: G-Mode through Bomb Blocks
note: Overload the scroll PLMs which are one tile to the left of the bomb blocks leading to Gauntlet.
Then pass through the bomb blocks (which will have become air).
If needed, continue on through the next set of bomb blocks (which will also be air) to reach the bottom right door.
devNote: FIXME: add something to indicate we can refill at the Ship on the way (e.g. if we add a logical requirement type for this).
This only affects the logic in the case where we can't walljump or get over the top in some other way.

strats.name: Come in Getting Blue Speed, Break Bomb Blocks
Come in With Blue Spring Ball Bounce, Break Bomb Blocks
Come In Blue Spinning, Space Jump Break Bomb Blocks
Come In With Temporary Blue, Break Bomb Blocks
G-Mode Morph
note: Overload the scroll PLMs which are one tile to the left of the bomb blocks leading to Gauntlet.
Then pass through the bomb blocks (which will have become air).
devNote: Other items (SpringBall or Power Bombs) could be used to get through but these cases are not relevant, as Bombs are needed to do anything useful with G-Mode Morph after this point.

strats.name: Transition with Stored Fall Speed (more speed)
strats.note: Break the Bomb blocks using Screw Attack in a Moonfall or SpeedBooster.

strats.name: Shinespark through Door
devNote: The Gauntlet Entrance door must be open, so the connecting room at 3 cannot be used.
Unlocking the door is free since the obstacle C cleared means that any lock was already taken care of.

strats.name: Big Jump with Speed and Screw
Landing Site Big Jump with Blue Speed
note: Use the runway near the top right door to jump towards the top left bomb blocks and break them using the blue speed from SpeedBooster.
This can be done using the full runway, with a one-tap shortcharge, where the tap is at the top of the lowest slope, and the jump is at the top of the last slope.
Alternatively, a controlled release of the jump button works in place of the shortcharge, where the bottom of the thick dark line in the background at the top of the room works as a visual cue.
Aiming down or morphing before hitting the wall can help make the jump slightly less precise.
Note that it is possible to jump all the way to the ledge above the bomb blocks, place a Power Bomb, then drop down, but it isn't typically easier.

strats.name: Landing Site Blue Space Jump (Top)
note: This strat is fairly precise. All jumps should be as small as possible.
Using at least one-tap short charge, jump off the ledge and descend as much as possible while keeping space jump active.
Once approaching the wall, be sure to jump again to continue through all of the bomb blocks.
If HiJump is available, it is much easier to use the blue space jump strat from the ground.
strats.devNote: Although there is a larger runway available, minimizing the speed is important.

strats.name: Landing Site Big Jump with Blue Speed Bounce
note: Use the runway near the top right door to jump towards the top left bomb blocks and break them using the blue speed from SpeedBooster.
This can be done using the full runway, with a one-tap shortcharge, where the tap is at the top of the lowest slope, and the jump is at the top of the last slope.
Alternatively, a controlled release of the jump button works in place of the shortcharge, where the bottom of the thick dark line in the background at the top of the room works as a visual cue.
While midair, morph once Samus begins descending to bounce through all of the Bomb blocks.

strats.name: Landing Site Big Jump Leave With Temporary Blue
note: Use the runway near the Power Bomb room door to jump to the left, morphing as Samus begins descending, to bounce through the Bomb blocks.
Any time while bouncing, hold an angle button and unmorph to gain temporary blue; then chain it to reach the door with temporary blue.
The jump can be set up by using the full runway with a one-tap shortcharge, with the tap being at the top of the lowest slope.

strats.name: Leave With Controlled Spring Ball Bounce (Long Runway)
note: Gain speed using the long runway at the top-right of room, do a big jump across the room into a mockball or speedball, then use controlled bounces to make it through the top-left door.
strats.devNote: Unlocking doors would be done ahead-of-time when the door is opened, i.e. when obstacle 'C' is set.

strats.name: Use Flash Suit, Speedy Blue Jump
note: Use the runway near the top right door to jump towards the top left bomb blocks and break them using the blue speed from SpeedBooster.
This can be done using the full runway, with a one-tap shortcharge, where the tap is at the top of the lowest slope, and the jump is at the top of the last slope.
Alternatively, a controlled release of the jump button works in place of the shortcharge, where the bottom of the thick dark line in the background at the top of the room works as a visual cue.
Aiming down before hitting the wall can help make the jump slightly less precise.
Use a flash suit to get through the remaining blocks.

strats.name: Use Flash Suit, Horizontal Spark
note: It is possible to save a small amount of energy by jumping from the upper right ledge, instead of from the plateau.
Use the cues in the background to spark at a precise height.
strats.devNote: This is only useful without SpeedBooster and without a way to refill at the ship - i.e. without wall jump to get back up.

strats.name: Gauntlet Wraparound Shot
note: Open the Gauntlet Entrance door by shooting a charged Wave shot through the right wall to wrap around to hit the door.
Near the top right door, move the right wall a bit off camera. Jump and shoot a charge shot diagonally into the floor just before landing while moving rightwards.
Listen for the door opening to ensure it worked.

strats.name: Shinespark through Door
devNote: Unlocking the door is free since the obstacle C cleared means that any lock was already taken care of.

strats.name: Big Jump Midair Shinespark
note: Store the spark on the right side of the ledge.  Run left and do a big jump towards the gauntlet door and then midair spark at the right time.
Do not jump to max height or Samus will run out of shinecharge frames, instead short the jump a little.
The lines in the background make for a good way to measure height.

strats.name: Big Jump Midair Shinespark Through Door
note: Store the spark on the right side of the ledge.  Run left and do a big jump towards the gauntlet door and then midair spark at the right time.
Do not jump to max height or Samus will run out of shinecharge frames, instead short the jump a little.
The lines in the background make for a good way to measure height.
devNote: Unlocking the door is free since the obstacle C cleared means that any lock was already taken care of.

strats.name: Landing Site Blue Space Jump (Mid)
strats.note: Use the lines in the background to determine the height of the breakable blocks.

strats.name: Landing Site Blue Space Jump (Bottom)
note: Starting near the right runway, run through the bomb block passage, then jump right after exiting.
Using HiJump and space jump, Samus is able to elevate enough to break through the bomb blocks blocking the Gauntlet entrance.

strats.name: Blue Springball Jump
note: From the right door, run and jump while on the dirt mound directly right of the ship.
Then SpringBall Jump to reach the Bomb blocks leading to Gauntlet.

strats.name: Transition with Stored Fall Speed (more speed)
strats.note: Break the Bomb blocks using Screw Attack in a Moonfall or SpeedBooster.

strats.name: G-Mode Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 3 screens.

strats.name: Shinespark Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 3 screens.

strats.name: Landing Site Crystal Flash X-Ray Climb
note: Become doorstuck in the bottom right door of Landing Site, using a Crystal Flash to continue X-Ray climbing past the slope above the door.
Start by climbing until the slope pushed Samus down.
Then auto-spinjump towards the door, and Morph to perform the Crystal Flash.
Finally, continue X-Ray climbing to the top door.
Climb up 3 screens.
strats.devNote: FIXME: Requires a way to take damage.

strats.name: Very Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
note: Enter with G-mode direct, back up to between 1 and 6 pixels from the door transition, and activate X-ray to get very deep stuck in the door.
Climb up 3 screens, and perform a turnaround buffered spin-jump away from the door to trigger the transition, bypassing any lock on the door.

strats.name: Leave with Runway
devNote: With SpeedBooster, climb the platforms to the ship, then run through the blocks.
Without, the runway is not as long, but it's much longer than it takes to get max run speed.

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.note: Shinespark diagonally from the small hill left of the ship to break part way into the hidden bomb wall, then use Bombs or another means to continue to the left.

strats.name: Speedy Jump Diagonal Spark
note: Finish a shinecharge right of the ship, then run left and jump from the hill left of the ship.
Turnaround to prevent moving too far horizontally, then spark diagonally at the peak of the jump.
With a higher speed, Samus can jump higher and lose less energy, but the shinecharge is tighter.

strats.name: Use Flash Suit, Break the Blocks
HiJump
strats.devNote: HiJump alone can only reach the lower bomb block.

strats.name: Use Flash Suit, Horizontal Spark
strats.devNote: This can be done with HiJump alone; it requires a precise spin jump and then a very precise horizontal spark at the top of the jump.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Power Bomb
note: Using IBJ to reach the Gauntlet entrance bomb blocks, place a Power Bomb and it will hit but not break the blocks.
Then IBJ up to to the left, unmorph and use X-Ray to cancel G-mode, the blocks will be broken, allowing Samus to pass through.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Screw Attack
strats.note: IBJ up to to the top left of the room. Use X-Ray to cancel G-mode, then fall with Screw Attack to break the bomb blocks.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Power Bomb
strats.note: Place a Power Bomb then quickly exit G-Mode before it explodes to break the bomb blocks.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph IBJ
strats.devNote: Over the wall.

strats.name: Leave Shinecharged
strats.devNote: FIXME: Add 3 room shinecharges.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
Transition with Stored Fall Speed (more speed)
Carry G-Mode Through Tube (Left to Right)
Carry G-Mode Morph Through Tube (Left to Right)
Leave Shinecharged
strats.devNote: FIXME: Add 3 room shinecharges.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
Transition with Stored Fall Speed (more speed)
Carry G-Mode Through Tube (Right to Left)
Carry G-Mode Morph Through Tube (Right to Left)

nodes.name: Bottom Right Door (On the Left Shaft)

to.note: This link is only for G-mode strats bypassing the junction. Other strats should go 1 -> 8 -> 2.
This link is only for G-mode strats bypassing the junction. Other strats should go 1 -> 8 -> 5.
This link is only for G-mode strats bypassing the junction. Other strats should go 2 -> 8 -> 1.
This link is only for G-mode strats bypassing the junction. Other strats should go 2 -> 8 -> 5.
This link is only for G-mode strats bypassing the junction. Other strats should go 4 -> 8 -> 2.
This link is only for G-mode strats bypassing the junction. Other strats should go 4 -> 8 -> 5.
This link is only for G-mode strats bypassing the junction. Other strats should go 5 -> 8 -> 1.
This link is only for G-mode strats bypassing the junction. Other strats should go 5 -> 8 -> 2.

strats.name: Leave with Runway, Come in with Speed to Break the Wall
G-Mode Setup - Bomb the Blocks and Get Hit By Geemer
note: Destroy the bomb wall to open a path for the Geemer to hit Samus through the transition.
If using a PB be careful not to kill the Geemer. Place the PB far left, next to the door, as the Geemer is leaving the flat part of the ceiling.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph through Terminator Bomb Blocks into Save
note: There are scroll PLMs one tile to the left of the Terminator bomb blocks which can be used to overload PLMs.
The bomb blocks then become air and can be passed through.
Go down to the Save door by falling and moving back and forth in the right places.
Once you start going down you will be off-screen.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph through Terminator Bomb Blocks into Alcatraz
note: There are scroll PLMs one tile to the left of the bomb blocks which can be used to overload PLMs.
The bomb blocks then become air and can be passed through.
Use Bombs, SpringBall, or a Geemer damage boost to get across the gap without unmorphing.
To survive a Geemer hit, you will need Varia or Gravity or to come in with more than 4 energy (e.g. by coming in with indirect G-mode after leaving with G-mode immobile).

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.devNote: FIXME: A strat could be added coming in shinecharged, with 1 frame, 1 excess frame, and no horizontal spark needed.

strats.name: G-Mode through Terminator Bomb Blocks (from Left)
note: There are scroll PLMs one tile to the left of the bomb blocks which can be used to overload PLMs.
The bomb blocks then become air and can be passed through.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph through Terminator Bomb Blocks (from Save)
note: Use G-Mode Morph to pass through the tunnel as you enter the room.
Then unmorph and get up to the top of the room normally.
There are scroll PLMs at the two-tile gap as you approach the Terminator bomb blocks, which can be used to overload PLMs.
The bomb blocks then become air and can be passed through.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Geemer
note: Wait 75 seconds for a global Geemer, or use a Super to grab a closer one.

strats.name: G-Mode Regain Mobility
strats.note: Wait 75 seconds for a global Geemer.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph into Alcatraz (from Save)
note: Use G-Mode Morph to pass through the tunnel as you enter the room.
Use Bombs or SpringBall to navigate to Alcatraz without unmorphing.

strats.name: Parlor X-Ray Climb
strats.note: This is a short climb of only a few tiles.

strats.name: Stored Moonfall Clip
strats.note: Moonfall to become stuck in the ground, then moonfall again to clip fully through the floor.

strats.name: G-Mode through Terminator Bomb Blocks (from Right)
note: There are scroll PLMs throughout the room, which will overload PLMs when going through them.
The bomb blocks then become air and can be passed through.

strats.name: Grapple Teleport
note: If entering the transition too deeply, Samus may end up stuck slightly inside the Bomb blocks and the floor.
This can be avoided by tapping up to retract Grapple (pulling Samus left and down), holding left while releasing Grapple, then jumping to clip up through the floor.
If Morph is available, rolling out to the left is also an option.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph into Save
strats.note: Use Bombs or SpringBall to navigate with artificial morph without unmorphing.

strats.name: Leave With Runway - Frozen Geemer
strats.note: There is a Geemer just below the door that only moves while on camera.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Geemer
strats.note: There is a Geemer just below the door that only moves while on camera.

strats.name: G-Mode Regain Mobility
strats.note: Wait 90 seconds for a global Geemer.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph into Alcatraz
strats.note: Use Bombs or SpringBall to navigate with artificial morph without unmorphing.

strats.name: Carry Shinecharge
note: Immediately after running off the ledge, turn back and press against the ledge, aim down, and shoot open the door.
Move left to avoid the floating platform, then hold right against the floating platform to make it over to the door.

strats.name: G-Mode through Terminator Bomb Blocks (from Right)
note: There are scroll PLMs throughout the room, which will overload PLMs when going through them.
The bomb blocks then become air and can be passed through.

strats.name: Grapple Teleport X-Ray Climb
note: Exit the previous room with Samus in a standing pose (while grappled).
After teleporting, press right to release Grapple while staying standing (not being forced into a crouch).
Then X-ray climb to get up to the door transition, without needing to open the door.
Samus will not be visible during the climb.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph into Save (from Landing Site)
note: A single Power Bomb, placed precisely and as early as possible, can get you over the Geemers and onto the ledge above Alcatraz without taking a hit.
Alternatively Bombs or SpringBall can be used.
Go down to the Save door by just falling and moving back and forth in the right places.
Once you start going down you will be off-screen.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Geemer
G-Mode Morph into Alcatraz (from Landing Site)
note: There are scroll PLMs one tile to the right of the bomb blocks which can be used to overload PLMs, turning the bomb blocks to air.
However, if Zebes is awake, two Geemers block the way.
With a regular G-mode setup and no suits, a single Geemer hit would kill Samus.
The Geemer hits can be avoided with Bombs or SpringBall.

Alternatively, a Power Bomb, placed precisely and as early as possible, can be used to jump onto the ledge and go around to the left entrance to Alcatraz (necessary since the Power Bomb blast will render the bomb blocks solid, unable to be turned to air).
A Geemer hit can also be tanked by having Varia or Gravity or by coming in with higher energy (e.g. with G-mode immobile).

strats.name: G-Mode Morph through Terminator Blocks (from Alcatraz)
note: Use Bombs or SpringBall to navigate with artificial morph without unmorphing.
There are scroll PLMs next to the bomb blocks and on the ledge below the Alcatraz exit, which will overload PLMs when going through them.
The bomb blocks then become air and can be passed through.
You will need to briefly navigate off-screen while to the right of Alcatraz before coming back left.

strats.name: Grapple Teleport X-Ray Climb
note: Exit the previous room with Samus in a standing pose (while grappled).
After teleporting, press right to release Grapple while staying standing (not being forced into a crouch).
Then X-ray climb to get up to the door transition, without needing to open the door.
Samus will not be visible during the climb.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph through Parlor Save Morph Tunnel (from Alcatraz)
note: Use Bombs or SpringBall to navigate with artificial morph without unmorphing.
There are scroll PLMs next to the bomb blocks and on the ledge below the Alcatraz exit, which will overload PLMs when going through them.
The bomb blocks then become air and can be passed through.
You will need to briefly navigate off-screen while to the right of Alcatraz before coming back left, and while going down the left shaft.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Geemer
note: It takes approximately 3.5 minutes for a global Geemer to reach this location,
but this can be reduced by using a Super between 19 and 33 seconds after entering the room, to make a Geemer fall and take a shorter path.

strats.name: G-Mode Regain Mobility
note: It takes approximately 3.5 minutes for a global Geemer to reach this location.
If using a Super, fire between 19 and 33 seconds after entering the room, then wait approximately 30 more seconds to be hit.
strats.devNote: FIXME: Should manipulating global enemies off screen be a tech?

strats.name: Alcatraz Escape
strats.note: Wall jump up and midair morph to get out without needing to break the bomb blocks to the right.

strats.name: Tricky Spring Ball Jump
note: Run and spin jump into a spring ball jump, starting from the floating platform.

strats.name: Tricky Dash Jump
note: The wall above can be used to align to a good starting position for the running jump.

strats.name: Frozen Geemer Alcatraz Escape
note: Wait 3 minutes for a global Geemer to waddle over, or shoot a Super 20 to 30 seconds after entering the room to knock it off the ceiling and save a lot of time.
Freeze the Geemer as it turns onto the middle slope of the left wall to escape - it helps to freeze the geemer from below.
Alternatively, use a Super to knock it off the wall and freeze it mid-air.
strats.devNote: This is only really useful without wall jumps.

strats.name: Alcatraz Escape with Grapple X-Ray Ceiling Clip
note: Wait for a global Geemer to make the long trip along the map, or shoot a Super 20 to 30 seconds after entering the room to knock it off the ceiling and save a lot of time.
Freeze it just after it starts climbing the bomb blocks.
Spin-jump above it, which will put Samus into a forced crouch where X-Ray cannot be used.
Use Grapple to kill a second Geemer, restoring the ability to use X-Ray.
Use X-Ray to stand up, then jump up through the ceiling.
devNote: Morph could also be used instead of Grapple, but with Morph there is an easier strat that goes up through the tunnel to the left.

strats.name: Alcatraz Escape with HiJump Ceiling Clip
note: Wait for a global Geemer to make the long trip along the map, or shoot a Super 20 to 30 seconds after entering the room to knock it off the ceiling and save a lot of time.
Hold right against the bomb blocks, take damage from the Geemer, jump, aim-down, and shoot the Geemer shortly before landing.
Samus should end up standing on the ground with the Geemer frozen on the wall with a 4-8 pixel gap between it and the ground (overlapping Samus' hitbox).
Facing the bomb blocks and pressed against them, jump while holding down (but not crouched) and then hold forward (or forward and down) 5 frames later to break the aim-down pose.
If successful, Samus will clip up through the ceiling.
This can be attempted several times before the Geemer thaws.

strats.name: Alcatraz Escape G-Mode Crystal Flash Then Forced Standup
note: Enter with direct G-Mode artificial morph, and perform a Crystal Flash to refill reserve energy.
Do this all the way to the left, to prevent the Geemer from being destroyed by the lingering light orb.
Wait for a global Geemer to make the long trip along the map, or shoot a Super 20 to 30 seconds after entering the room to knock it off the ceiling and save a lot of time.
Either way, after the Geemer comes down into Alcatraz, shoot a Super to knock it off the ledge to make it bypass the light orb.
Damage down until one Geemer hit away from running out of energy.

If Samus has at least one Energy Tank, it will take longer to damage down, in which case an additional Super can be used to knock the Geemer onto the floating platform, to allow unlimited time for damaging down.
A final Super can be used to knock the Geemer off the floating platform.
Set reserves to manual, stand next to the bomb blocks, and wait for the Geemer to approach.
Just before taking a hit, press pause.
During the fade-out, hold forward to land quickly after knockback.
At a precise moment just before the pause hits, jump and aim down; the aim-down can be buffered before jumping, e.g. by rolling from forward to down through a diagonal input.
Set reserves to auto, then unpause while continuing to hold jump.
If successful, the forced stand-up will occur close to the ceiling and while Samus still has upward momentum, allowing Samus to clip through.
strats.devNote: FIXME: A version of this strat could be added with canRiskPermanentLossOfAccess requiring fewer Supers and time, if Samus has no tanks.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Alcatraz Escape
note: Use Bombs or SpringBall to navigate with artificial morph without unmorphing.
There are scroll PLMs next to the bomb blocks and on the ledge below the Alcatraz exit, which will overload PLMs when going through them.
The bomb blocks then become air and can be passed through.

strats.name: Alcatraz Escape Double Damage Boost
note: Wait 3 minutes for a global Geemer to waddle over, or shoot a Super 20 to 30 seconds after entering the room to knock it off the ceiling and save a lot of time.
Damage down until Samus is one Geemer hit away from running out of energy, and set reserves to manual.
Crouch jump at a very precise time and mid-air morph to contact the Geemer at the peak of the jump, pressing pause to be in the fade-out while getting hit and reaching 0 energy.
Set reserves to auto, unpause, and hold left.
While reserves are auto-refilling, Samus' i-frames will run out, allowing Samus to be hit by the Geemer again and be boosted high enough to reach the ledge.
The screen will be black, which can be fixed by pausing and unpausing again.

strats.name: G-Mode through Terminator Bomb Blocks (from Right)
note: There are scroll PLMs throughout the room, which will overload PLMs when going through them.
The bomb blocks then become air and can be passed through.

strats.name: Grapple Teleport X-Ray Climb
note: Exit the previous room with Samus in a standing pose (while grappled).
After teleporting, press right to release Grapple while staying standing (not being forced into a crouch).
Then X-ray climb to get up to the door transition, without needing to open the door.
Samus will not be visible during the climb.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph into Save
strats.note: Use Bombs or SpringBall to navigate with artificial morph without unmorphing.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph into Alcatraz
note: Use Bombs or SpringBall to navigate with artificial morph without unmorphing.

strats.name: Leave With Runway - Frozen Geemer
strats.note: Wait 2 minutes for a global Geemer, or use a Super to grab a closer one.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Geemer
note: Wait 2 minutes for a global Geemer, or use a Super to grab a closer one.

strats.name: G-Mode Regain Mobility
strats.note: Wait 2 minutes for a global Geemer.

strats.name: Parlor Carry Shinecharge From Right to Bottom
note: Walk off the ledge (rather than running off), aim down, and shoot.
Depending on your momentum coming in, if Zebes is awake you may need to shoot down twice, once to kill the Geemer and once to open the door.
Press forward against the floating platform to make it through the door.

strats.name: G-Mode through Terminator Bomb Blocks (from Right)
note: There are scroll PLMs throughout the room, which will overload PLMs when going through them.
The bomb blocks then become air and can be passed through.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph into Save
strats.note: Use Bombs or SpringBall to navigate with artificial morph without unmorphing.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph into Alcatraz
note: Use Bombs or SpringBall to navigate with artificial morph without unmorphing.

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.devNote: This strat is not useful in-room, but can satisfy a strat in the room before with an exit shinespark.

strats.name: Parlor Ice Moonfall Door Lock Skip
note: Use a Super to bring a Geemer down to the bottom floating platform.
Freeze this Geemer along with a Geemer on the floor and use them to perform an enemy-stuck moonfall.
After gaining sufficient speed, move toward the door and clip through the door shell.
Falling with too much speed can cause Samus to go out of bounds.

strats.name: Parlor Ice Moonfall Door Lock Skip Without Supers
note: Freeze a Geemer on the right of the overhang just below the door to Final Missile Bombway.
Freeze a second Geemer on the top left of its platform and setup a moonfall between them.
Fall off the Geemers and clip past the floating platform below, past the door shell, and into the transition.
This setup is highly precise; if you do not have the right speed you may land on the platform below or the door shell.
Falling with too much speed can also cause Samus to go out of bounds.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Parlor Downward G-Mode Setup with Ice
note: Freeze a Geemer on the bottom of the overhang just below the door to Final Missile Bombway. Freeze a second Geemer on the top left of its platform and setup a moonfall between them.

Fall off the Geemers and clip into the tile left of the door. Press up to get out of crouch and lose the stored vertical speed (so that X-Ray works). Then turn-around, open the door, and go into the door transition as the third Geemer hits you.

Falling off the frozen Geemers requires relatively high precision: This setup is a 4 frame window, not too far left, so you can get to the door transition, not too far right such that you enter the transition when falling.

strats.name: G-Mode Regain Mobility
note: Line up with the far right or left side of doorframe in the room below, to be able to not fall back through after entry, as the door remains open.
Be careful not to fall into the door while being hit by the Geemer.

strats.name: Parlor Quick Charge
strats.note: Break the bomb wall while blue, or spark diagonally next to it.
strats.devNote: It is possible to come in the top right door, charge a spark, use a bounce ball, or blue space jump, but this is a bit easier anyway.

strats.name: Parlor Quick Charge, Leave Sparking
strats.note: Break the bomb wall while blue, or spark diagonally next to it. Open the door then charge the spark again and spark through the wall and door.
strats.devNote: The canCarefulJump or 2 spark frames could be reduced by having the door already open, but that's probably not worth modeling.

strats.name: Leave with Runway, Short Charge to Break the Wall
G-Mode Setup - Power Bomb the Blocks from Below and Get Hit By Geemer
note: Place the Power Bomb below the bomb blocks as the Geemer is leaving the flat part of the ceiling to break it and let the Geemer through.
This opens a path for the Geemer to hit Samus through the transition.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Speed Through the Blocks then Get Hit By Geemer
note: After the Geemer is near, destroy the bomb wall using blue speed from the right.
This opens a path for the Geemer to hit Samus through the transition.

strats.name: Leave Shinecharged, Using the Raised Platform
Leave Shinecharged, Using the Left of the Raised Platform
Geemer Farm
strats.devNote: FIXME: Other nodes could be used to reset the room, with additional requirements.

nodes.name: Bottom Left Door Spawn At Junction

strats.name: G-Mode through Bomb Blocks
strats.note: Overload PLMs using scroll blocks a few tiles in front of the bomb blocks.

strats.name: Climb Behemoth Shinespark (Top Door)
note: Diagonal shinespark up the climb to break the bomb blocks to the top right morph tunnel.
A consistent place to spark from is the small platform below the bomb block, using a crouch jump and then a diagonal spark (not a crouched diagonal spark).

strats.name: Climb Behemoth Shinespark (Top Door, Through Toilet)
note: Diagonal shinespark up the climb to break the bomb blocks to the top right morph tunnel.
A consistent place to spark from is the small platform below the bomb block, using a crouch jump and then a diagonal spark (not a crouched diagonal spark).

strats.name: G-Mode Morph through Bomb Blocks
strats.note: Overload PLMs using the scroll block next to the bomb blocks.
strats.devNote: PBs cannot be used, as they will solidify the bomb blocks.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph through Bomb Blocks
strats.note: Overload PLMs using the scroll block next to the bomb blocks.

strats.name: Leave with Extended Runway, Open Both Doors
Crystal Flash
strats.devNote: An unheated lava crystal flash could be added instead, but that would change the strats that come after.

strats.name: Behemoth Spark Top, Come in Shinecharging
strats.note: Starting with a crouch, diagonal shinespark to the top to break the bomb blocks to the morph tunnels on the right.

strats.name: Climb G-Mode Morph Blind Climb to the Top
note: Overload PLMs using the scroll blocks next to the bomb wall
After passing through, you need to go from the bottom to the top of Climb and into the bomb blocks while still in G-mode Morph.
Samus will not be visible at all; the only available feedback is audio and position on the map.

strats.name: Behemoth Spark Bottom, Come in Shinecharging
strats.note: Diagonal shinespark up the climb to break the bomb blocks to the morph tunnels on the right.

strats.name: Behemoth Spark Bottom, Come in Shinecharging, Race the Lava
strats.note: Diagonal shinespark up the climb to break the bomb blocks to the morph tunnels on the right.

strats.name: Climb Temporary Blue Chain Through Bomb Blocks Without XRay (Bottom Left to Bottom, Cross-Room)
strats.note: A Temporary Blue Chain with movement assists to climb up and destroy the bomb blocks blocking the bottom morph tunnel.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Blind
note: Overload PLMs using the scroll blocks next to the bomb wall
Navigate to the lower right bomb blocks while still morphed.
Samus will be off-camera and not visible, requiring blind movement.
Enemies will not hurt Samus since they are non-global and also off-camera.

strats.name: Transition with Stored Fall Speed (Shortcharge, more speed)
Transition with Stored Fall Speed (Screw Fall)
strats.note: Break the Bomb blocks using Screw Attack in a Moonfall, then escape the tiles with Grapple Beam.

strats.name: Come In Speedballing
strats.note: If needed, unmorph while passing through the blocks to break more than just the bottom one.
devNote: If we had a comeInWithSpeedball entrance condition, it should be used instead.
This strat is for using a remote runway in the previous room to get the speedball;
if the current runway were used then you could just run through with blue speed instead.

strats.name: Come In With Blue Spring Ball Bounce
Come In With Blue Space Jump
G-Mode through Bomb Blocks
strats.note: Overload PLMs using the scroll blocks immediately in front of the bomb wall
strats.devNote: This could be possible with the lava, but it would be blind and very tight.

strats.name: Zebes Ablaze
strats.devNote: These are destroyed on entry if Zebes is Ablaze.

strats.name: G-Mode through Bomb Blocks
note: Overload PLMs using the scroll block at the top of the stairs immediately in front of the bomb blocks.
Reach the bottom and pass through the bomb blocks while still in G-mode.
strats.devNote: PBs cannot be used, as they will solidify the bomb blocks.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph through Bomb Blocks
note: Overload PLMs using the scroll block at the top of the stairs immediately in front of the bomb blocks.
Fall down to the lower bomb blocks while still in G-mode Morph.
strats.devNote: PBs cannot be used, as they will solidify the bomb blocks.

strats.name: Climb Morph Tunnel SpeedBall (Top Right)
strats.note: Enter the room with a very specific run speed to jump from the door, and land a speedball perfectly in the tunnel to break the Bomb block.
devNote: There is 1 unusable tile in this runway.
Speeds between $6.2 and $6.A can also work but are more difficult.

strats.name: Temporary Blue Spring Ball (Come in Shinecharging)
strats.devNote: There is 1 unusable tile in this runway.

strats.name: Temporary Blue Spring Ball (Come in With Temporary Blue)
G-Mode Morph through Bomb Blocks
strats.note: Overload PLMs using the scroll block at the top of the stairs next to the bomb blocks.
strats.devNote: PBs cannot be used, as they will solidify the bomb blocks.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph through Bomb Blocks
note: Overload PLMs using the scroll block at the top of the stairs next to the bomb blocks.
Fall down and pass through bomb wall at the bottom while still in G-mode.
strats.devNote: PBs cannot be used, as they will solidify the bomb blocks.

strats.name: Right-Side X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 7 screens.

strats.name: Very Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
note: Enter with G-mode direct, back up to between 1 and 6 pixels from the door transition, and activate X-ray to get very deep stuck in the door.
Climb up 7 screens, and perform a turnaround buffered spin-jump away from the door to trigger the transition, bypassing any lock on the door.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph
note: Overload PLMs using the scroll block at the top of the stairs next to the bomb blocks.
If Morph is not available, careful movement is needed with SpringBall to reach the top without taking a hit or unmorphing.

strats.name: Climb G-Mode Morph Insane IBJ to Top (from Crateria Supers Bottom)
note: Overload PLMs using the scroll block at the top of the stairs next to the bomb blocks.
A long series of precise bomb jumps and enemy manipulations are required to reach the top without taking a hit.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph IBJ with PBs
note: Overload PLMs using the scroll block at the top of the stairs next to the bomb blocks.
Place PBs as high as possible to occasionally kill multiple pirates at a time.

strats.name: Leave with Runway
strats.devNote: It is sometimes possible to beat the lava, but it depends how you get here.

strats.name: Climb Morph Tunnel SpeedBall (Lower Right)
strats.note: Enter the room with a very specific run speed to jump from the door, squeeze by the ceiling, and land a speedball perfectly in the tunnel to break the Bomb block.
devNote: There is 1 unusable tile in this runway.
The canBeExtremelyPatient requirement is for difficulty placement.

strats.name: Temporary Blue Spring Ball (Come in Shinecharging)
strats.devNote: There is 1 unusable tile in this runway.

strats.name: Temporary Blue Spring Ball (Come in With Temporary Blue)
G-Mode Morph through Bomb Blocks
strats.devNote: PBs cannot be used, as they will solidify the bomb blocks.

strats.name: Come In Speedballing
strats.note: If needed, unmorph while passing through the blocks to break more than just the bottom one.
devNote: If we had a comeInWithSpeedball entrance condition, it should be used instead.
This strat is for using a remote runway in the previous room to get the speedball;
if the current runway were used then you could just run through with blue speed instead.

strats.name: Come In With Blue Spring Ball Bounce
Transition with Stored Fall Speed (Shortcharge, more speed)
Transition with Stored Fall Speed (Screw Fall)
strats.note: Break the Bomb blocks using Screw Attack in a Moonfall, then escape the tiles with Grapple Beam.

strats.name: Behemoth Spark Top, Come in Shinecharging
strats.note: Starting with a crouch, diagonal shinespark to the top to break the bomb blocks to the morph tunnels on the right.

strats.name: X-Ray Climb to Break Bomb Block with Screw Attack
note: Use an X-Ray climb to position Samus to where she can break the Bomb block with Screw Attack.
This is an 8 screen climb.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph
note: Overload PLMs using the scroll block next to any of the bomb blocks in the room, allowing passage through the bomb blocks at the top by making them become air.
If Morph is not available, careful movement is needed with SpringBall to reach the top without taking a hit or unmorphing.

strats.name: Climb G-Mode Morph Insane IBJ to Top (from Pit Room)
note: A long series of precise bomb jumps and enemy manipulations are required to reach the top without taking a hit or unmorphing.
Overload PLMs using the scroll block next to the bomb blocks at the top, allowing passage through them by making them become air.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph IBJ with PBs
note: Overload PLMs using the scroll block at the top of the stairs next to the bomb blocks.
Place PBs as high as possible to occasionally kill multiple pirates at a time.
Overload the PLMs at the bottom, if the top bomb block is hit with a PB before PLMs are overloaded, they will remain solid.

strats.name: Behemoth Spark Bottom, Come in Shinecharging
strats.note: Diagonal shinespark up the climb to break the bomb blocks to the morph tunnels on the right.

strats.name: X-Ray Climb to Break Bomb Block with Screw Attack
note: Use an X-Ray climb to position Samus to where she can break the Bomb block with Screw Attack.
This is a 1 screen climb.
strats.devNote: This is an alternative to using Moonfall to break the block with Screw Attack.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph
note: Overload PLMs using the scroll block next to the bottom right bomb blocks, allowing passage through them by making them become air.
If Morph is unavailable, then careful movement will be required to get past the Pirates without taking a hit.
If using a PB to kill the pirates, overload the PLMs at the bottom. If the top bomb block is hit with a PB before PLMs are overloaded, they will remain solid.

strats.name: Leave with Runway
devNote: This is relatively tight when coming in from the bottom left and using a Power Bomb to break the wall.
It wouldn't work if the door was Missile or Power Bomb locked.

strats.name: Leave with Extended Runway, Open Both Doors
Zebes Ablaze
strats.devNote: These are destroyed on entry if Zebes is Ablaze.

strats.name: Behemoth Spark Top
strats.note: Starting with a crouch, diagonal shinespark to the top to break the bomb blocks to the morph tunnels on the right.

strats.name: Behemoth Spark Top, Use Flash Suit
note: Diagonal shinespark to break the bomb blocks to the morph tunnel on the right.
Spark from the highest platform that is only one tile from the right wall (the morph tunnel will be off camera, but can be seen while jumping).
From this platform, the shinespark can be done with or without a crouch.

strats.name: Climb Temporary Blue Chain Through Bomb Blocks to Top
strats.note: A long Temporary Blue Chain with x-ray turnarounds to climb up and destroy the bomb blocks blocking the top morph tunnel.
strats.devNote: The runway was reduced by 0.5 tiles, as you can't maintain Temporary Blue directly against a wall.

strats.name: Behemoth Spark Bottom
strats.note: Diagonal shinespark up the climb to break the bomb blocks to the morph tunnels on the right.

strats.name: Climb Moonfall Block Break
note: The bomb blocks can be broken by spinjumping with Screw attack and holding right, if moonfall makes Samus clip through the platform.
Use the small blue platform 2nd from the top on the right side.

strats.name: Behemoth Spark Bottom, Use Flash Suit
note: Diagonal shinespark to break the bomb blocks to the morph tunnel on the right.
Spark from the lowest platform that is only one tile from the right wall (part of the bottom right door will be on screen).
From this platform, the shinespark must be done from a crouch.
It is possible to set up a frozen pirate on the right wall to stop the shinespark early.
devNote: For the frozen pirate strat, it is assumed that Samus can farm the energy after the spark, resulting in no damaging shinespark frames.
FIXME: It is still possible to set up a frozen pirate, even when shinecharging on the floor.

strats.name: Climb Temporary Blue Chain Through Bomb Blocks (Bottom Left to Bottom)
strats.note: A Temporary Blue Chain with x-ray turnarounds to climb up and destroy the bomb blocks blocking the bottom morph tunnel.
strats.devNote: The runway was reduced by 0.5 tiles, as you can't maintain Temporary Blue directly against a wall.

strats.name: Climb Temporary Blue Chain Through Bomb Blocks Without XRay (Bottom Left to Bottom, In-Room)
strats.note: A Temporary Blue Chain with movement assists to climb up and destroy the bomb blocks blocking the bottom morph tunnel.

strats.name: Space Pirate Farm
devNote: The Space Pirates (wall) drop Supers and Power Bombs each at a 0.4% rate, too low to put into logic.
FIXME: Other nodes could be used to reset the room, with additional requirements.

strats.name: Base
strats.devNote: When Samus enters the room from the bottom left, lava starts to rise. In the escape it is acid instead.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
Temporary Blue (Come In Shinecharging)
strats.note: Breaking the side blocks can be done with a shinespark, or by moving into them once past the solid blocks.

strats.name: Temporary Blue With X-Ray (Come In Shinecharging)
strats.note: Breaking the side blocks can be done by moving into them once past the solid blocks.

strats.name: Temporary Blue (Come In With Temporary Blue)
G-Mode Morph to Bomb the Bomb Blocks
note: Overload PLMs using the scroll block directly above the bomb block leading down to the item.
When the bomb blocks turn to air, lay bombs as Samus falls.
After landing on the first platform, quickly unmorph and use X-ray to cancel G-mode before the bombs explode.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph to Power Bomb the Bomb Blocks
strats.note: Lay a Power Bomb to break the bomb blocks leading down to the item, then use X-ray to cancel G-mode, to clear the blocks.

strats.name: G-Mode Through the Bomb Blocks
note: Overload PLMs using the scroll block directly above the bomb block leading down to the item.
Using X-Ray to cancel G-mode will lead to a soft lock if the item there can't be used to get Samus out.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
G-Mode Regain Mobility
strats.note: The enemies do not spawn in this room unless Missiles and Morph are collected (even if Zebes is awake).

strats.name: Full Room Temporary Blue (Come in Shinecharging)
strats.note: Bring temporary blue from the right side door all the way to the missile location using Springball, SpaceJump, or Morph-UnMorphs.
strats.devNote: There is 1 unusable tile in this runway.

strats.name: Full Room Temporary Blue (Come in With Temporary Blue)
G-Mode Through the Bomb Blocks
note: Be careful not to touch any of the pirates spawned lasers.
Overload PLMs using the scroll block directly above the bomb block leading down to the item.
Using X-Ray to cancel G-mode will lead to a soft lock if the item there can't be used to get Samus out.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph to Bomb the Bomb Blocks
note: Without Morph, the pirates will not spawn.
Overload PLMs using the scroll block directly above the bomb block leading down to the item.
When the bomb blocks turn to air, lay bombs as Samus falls.
After landing on the first platform, quickly unmorph and use X-Ray to cancel G-mode before the bombs explode.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph to Power Bomb the Bomb Blocks
note: Without Morph, the pirates will not spawn.
Use Power Bomb horizontal boosts to move toward the left side of the room in artificial morph.
Roll off the third blue platform from the right door and lay a Power Bomb against the left wall to get into range of the bomb blocks.
Unmorph and use X-ray to cancel G-mode. It may be best to do this before the PB explodes, in case PLMs are already overloaded.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Spring Ball to Power Bomb the Bomb Blocks
note: Without Morph, the pirates will not spawn.
While near the bomb blocks, use a Power Bomb and then use X-ray to cancel G-mode, which will clear the blocks.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Mellow
G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Mellow
Leave Spinning
strats.devNote: Leaving with lower speed (e.g. $1.2) is possible with SpeedBooster equipped; not sure if this matters for anything though.

strats.name: Leave With Spring Ball Bounce
devNote: One tile of landing runway is unusable; it could be used with a shorter remoteRunway, but there's no application yet.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Mellow
Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
G-Mode Setup - Get Hit By Mellow
Final Missile Bombway Shinespark
strats.note: Tight movement is needed to enter with a shinecharge, carry it through the morph tunnel, and spark out the right door in time.
strats.devNote: There doesn't appear to be enough time to spark out in a 'top' position.

strats.name: Temporary Blue Bounce (Come in Shinecharging)
strats.devNote: There is 1 unusable tile in this runway.

strats.name: Temporary Blue Bounce (Come in With Spring Ball Bounce)
Temporary Blue Bounce (Come in With Temporary Blue)
G-mode Morph with Bombs
strats.note: Repeatedly bomb the crumble blocks until the PLMs are overloaded.

19.name: Bomb Torizo Room
19.devNote: Could it be a different actual room during the escape sequence?

strats.name: Leave With Spring Ball Bounce (Bomb Torizo Intact)
Leave With Spring Ball Bounce (Bomb Torizo Dead)
Leave With Runway - Frozen Alcoon
note: Wait for the Alcoon to walk off and reach the bottom of the slope.
Dodge it's fireballs with Morph or Screw, or simply freeze it and wait while standing behind it.
Keep a half-tile gap between the Alcoon and the runway in order to extend the runway as much as possible.

strats.name: Alcoon Farm
note: The Alcoons have a 99.5% Power Bomb drop rate, after which they only drop small energy.
devNote: The energy dropped is too low even for a very patient strat, considering worst-case scenarios such as a neighboring heated room, no beams, and the possible need to refill several tanks worth of energy.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: Duck under the first two Alcoon shots, or retreat back a platform to fight them with Power Beam.
strats.devNote: All the Alcoons are assumed killed in each case.

nodes.name: Top Junction with Temporary Blue (Right of Morph Tunnel)

to.devNote: No strat for getting through the Boyons with a dboost, since it's redundant with the bluesuit jump.

strats.name: X-Mode, Leave Shinecharged
strats.devNote: Two spike hits are expected per attempt (with any additional leniency hits being multiplied by this amount).

strats.name: Direct G-Mode Morph Ceiling Bomb Jump
G-Mode Morph
devNote: This is a softlock unless the item is Morph.
The IBJ strat has 2 extra spike hits added as a leniency.

strats.name: Speedy Jump Spring Fling
strats.note: Run and jump into an airball, pressing pause just as Samus hits the ceiling, in order to unequip Spring Ball to reset fall speed.
strats.devNote: This can be done with 26 tiles of other-room runway, but it would probably require a higher movement tech.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph and Bombs to Overload Speed Blocks
strats.devNote: The IBJ from spikes has 2 extra spike hits added as a leniency.

strats.name: G-Mode and Grapple to Overload Grapple Blocks
strats.note: Quickly grapple to then release grapple on the grapple blocks a few times until they stop working. Be careful not to fall into the spikes.
strats.devNote: FIXME: Grapple will quickly overload PLMS.  It is barely possible to cross the gap using short grapples, canResetFallSpeed, and ending with a swing.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph Overload PLMs by PBing Super Item
strats.note: Place the PBs exactly two tiles left of the Morph tunnel. Be sure not to touch the item if this strat will be needed again in the future.
devNote: FIXME Add strat for going down without PBs, by using the uncollected item to overload PLMs. This can only be done once, as it forces item pickup.

strats.name: SpaceJump Speedball
strats.devNote: There is 1 unusable tile in this runway.

strats.name: Blue Spring Ball Bounce (Come in Getting Blue Speed)
note: Use Springball on the spikes to cross the room with a Speedball.
Then bounce into the Morph tunnel and use Springball to bounce all of the way through.
It can help to unmorph before the Morph tunnel and use temporary blue to start the bounce into the tunnel.
strats.devNote: Higher and lower run speeds can also work but may need to jump earlier or take additional spike hits.

strats.name: Spring Fling Temporary Blue (Come in Getting Blue Speed)
strats.note: Run and jump into an airball, pressing pause just as Samus hits the ceiling, in order to unequip Spring Ball to reset fall speed.

strats.name: Spring Fling Temporary Blue (Come in With Blue Spring Ball Bounce)
Temporary Blue Springball Bounce
note: Use Springball on the spikes to cross the room while retaining temporary blue.
Then use Spring Ball to bounce all of the way through the Morph tunnel.

strats.name: X-Mode BlueSuit
strats.note: Enter with a shinespark ready, activate XMode by bouncing into the spikes, then activate the shinespark but release XMode during the shinespark windup animation.
devNote: One leniency spikehit given.
There is 1 unusable tile in this runway.

strats.name: Crateria Supers In-Room X-Mode BlueSuit
strats.note: Use X-Mode to store a spikesuit, and then convert that to a blue suit with more X-Mode.
strats.devNote: One leniency spikehit given.

strats.name: Speedkeep (Come in With Temporary Blue)
note: Bounce into the spikes and use a SpeedKeep to run on spikes to setup for a speedball towards the item.
Bouncing on the platform near the door saves a spike hit.

strats.name: SpeedKeep for Temporary Blue, Slow Entry, Bounce on Runway
note: Bounce into the spikes and use a SpeedKeep to run on spikes to setup for a speedball towards the item.
Bouncing on the platform near the door saves a spike hit.
Or a DamageBoost SpeedKeep could be used instead of a Spike SpeedKeep with enough runspeed.

strats.name: SpeedKeep for Temporary Blue
note: Bounce into the spikes and use a SpeedKeep to run on spikes to setup for a speedball towards the item.
A DamageBoost SpeedKeep could be used instead of a Spike SpeedKeep with enough runspeed.

strats.name: Climb Supers In-Room SpeedKeep for Temporary Blue
note: Using only the short runway and spike pit, use one or more SpeedKeeps to Speedball towards the Super Missile item location.
This requires either a very short shortcharge, or a second SpeedKeep in the spikes which also resets Samus' run speed with a crouch jump before spike I-Frames expire.

strats.name: X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 7 screens.

strats.name: Very Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
note: Enter with G-mode direct, back up to between 1 and 6 pixels from the door transition, and activate X-ray to get very deep stuck in the door.
Climb up 7 screens, and perform a turnaround buffered spin-jump away from the door to trigger the transition, bypassing any lock on the door.

strats.name: Grapple Teleport
note: Samus will enter the room grappled to a spike block below.
Release Grapple quickly after entering, then aim up and grapple onto a Grapple block on the ceiling to avoid taking spike damage.

strats.name: Leave with Runway, Frozen Boyon Bridge
Frozen Boyon Runway and Fast Walljumps
note: Quickly Walljump to conserve health on the shinespark.

strats.name: Frozen Boyon Runway and HiJump
note: Use an extra speedy jump or walljump to conserve health on the shinespark.

strats.name: Dead Boyon Quick Charge
note: This is doable without a short charge, but it's essentially harder than the bluesuit jump.
With a quick charge, it can serve as a less scary strat.

strats.name: Screw Attack Jump
strats.note: Store a Shinespark and then jump through the Boyons using Screw Attack.
strats.devNote: There could be another tile if the door is open, but it shouldn't matter at this runway length with canCarefulJump.

strats.name: BlueSuit Jump through Boyons
strats.note: Charge a Shinespark running left, then get blue suit speed by running back to the right to jump through the Boyons.

strats.name: Crateria Supers G-Mode Up with PBs
strats.note: Wall jump up 9 times, placing a PB at the top. Only works in direct g-mode with the item still uncollected.
strats.devNote: FIXME: Using this strat won't risk canRiskPermanentLossOfAccess if the player could x-ray climb instead. However if the adjacent room is heated and Samus is really low energy, this could be a problem.

strats.name: Crateria Supers G-Mode Morph Long Ceiling Bomb Jump
note: Ascend with a long IBJ, then ceiling bomb jump against the speed blocks to overload the PLMs. Falling is very unforgiving.
Note that the boyons can be killed with bombs.
strats.devNote: This is technically doable without canBePatient, but would require double bomb jump, morph, a way to bypass Boyons, and never falling.

strats.name: Take Boyon Damage
strats.note: Intentionally take damage before attempting to jump through to avoid falling in the acid.

strats.name: Screw Attack
strats.note: Jump at the last tile to make it through all of the Boyons.

strats.name: Jump Under Boyons
strats.devNote: It's not really insane jump difficult, but that is where you think about needing to avoid the damage.  And failing the jump is still very punishing due to falling into the acid.

strats.name: Base
strats.devNote: The strat specific requirements are included when clearing the abstract obstacle.

strats.name: Remote Acquire Item
strats.note: Walk through the item or use Bombs to overload PLMs, fall through the speed blocks, then exit G-Mode to remote acquire the item.

strats.name: Jump into Ceiling Bomb Jump Over Spikes
Take Boyon Damage
strats.note: Intentionally take damage before attempting to jump through to avoid falling in the acid.

strats.name: Screw Attack
strats.note: Jump at the last tile to make it through all of the Boyons.

strats.name: Jump Under Boyons
strats.devNote: It's not really insane jump difficult, but that is where you think about needing to avoid the damage.  And failing the jump is still very punishing due to falling into the acid.

strats.name: Jump Over the Speed Blocks
note: Unmorph on the leftmost edge of the Speed blocks and jump across.
Landing on the right side Speedblock, and the solid tile, gives enough time to run to the item and fall before the block respawns.
Or jump fully over the Speed blocks and turn around using X-Ray after collecting the item.

strats.name: Base
strats.devNote: Samus is in a Speedball or BlueSuit state.

strats.name: Elevator Crystal Flash for Flash Suit
strats.note: In order to align and place a Power Bomb at the correct pixel, jump and hit the ceiling in the aim-down pose, then morph on the descent.
